summary: This is an email chain from UBS Private Wealth Advisor Scott Stackman, dated January 16, 2014, recapping a meeting with Ghislaine Maxwell. It details Maxwell's financial situation, investment plans, and personal affairs, including her desire to manage her wealth through UBS and her lack of heirs. The email was forwarded in August 2020, indicating its relevance to later investigations.

connections.description: Stackman is a UBS Private Wealth Advisor recapping a financial meeting with client Ghislaine Maxwell, discussing her investments and asset management.
Maxwell's assistant (Dana) is instructed to provide financial statements and handle processes for her.
Stackman is asked to introduce Maxwell to Bill Sutton for philanthropy matters.
Maxwell requests an introduction to Bill Sutton regarding philanthropy.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Meeting with UBS
events.description: A meeting between Ghislaine Maxwell and UBS Private Wealth Advisor Scott Stackman to discuss her financial investments, assets, and banking needs.

events.title: Email Forwarded to Investigators
events.description: The 2014 email recap of the Maxwell meeting is forwarded to individuals (likely investigators Fleming Andrew and Paul Frown), indicating its review in the investigation.

locations: 299 Park Avenue 25th Floor New York, NY 10171
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell had a meeting with UBS Private Wealth Management in January 2014 to manage $15 million in investments ($10M invested, $5M in cash) with explicit instructions for no lock-up periods.
Maxwell stated she had no heirs, wanted to 'die with a Penny,' and her assistant would have Power of Attorney over everything.
Maxwell was considering selling her townhouse for $17 million and discussed joining a hedge fund that uses maritime activity for investment decisions, backed by someone who 'worked for Obama.'

The email, originally sent in 2014, was forwarded in August 2020 to individuals with identifiers suggesting law enforcement or investigative roles (e.g., 'G-INV1'), indicating it became evidence in an investigation.
Maxwell's company 'Terremar' was mentioned as holding cash, and she requested introductions for philanthropy purposes to Bill Sutton.
